column4: today I ran memtest86+ and got 1 error... Ubuntu runs fine, however. Can I continue to ignore it or will this come back to haunt me?
try the test several mre times
how many physical memory module sdo you ahve
remvoe one retest if it passes  then do the same for the second
when you figure which module is failing replace it
the risk of not doing so is corruping your files
okay, well, when I get time...
try to do it asap unless you already have a backup of your data prior to the failing memory module
It's late now, and my finances might not allow me to get a new stick. I'll have to run at half-mem for a while, eh?
I would better to be a bit sluggish than to lose info
I'll find time to run two of those freaking ling scans....
check with the store you purchased the memory at cahnces are it may have a lifetime warranty..in that case all you need is the invoice and you ship it to the manufacturer
that's where it gets tricky... Newegg purchase...
the mem manufacturer will still honour it
